heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not a heatwave right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.5°C) and outside temperature (down 4.3°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 11265 lux) and pressure (down 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9519 lux) and cloud levels (up 954 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 265.4m lower than yesterday, 79.4m higher than the past week, 953.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 767m to 3570m and averaged 1587.1m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and bright intervals likely. Weather patterns to stay the same.
